Edit this Page
Library Installation
Obtaining the library
The ownCloud iOS library may be obtained from the following Github
repository:
owncloud/ios-library
Once obtained, this code should be compiled with Xcode 6. The Github
repository not only contains the library, ownCloud iOS library, but also
contains a sample project, OCLibraryExample, which will assist in
learning how to use the library. Compile the ownCloud iOS library and run the project. A
libownCloudiOS.a
file will be generated. At this stage, the library is included on your project and you can start
communicating with the ownCloud server. Add the file
ownCloud iOS library.xcodeproj
to the project via drag and drop. Sources
Creating a static library in iOS tutorial (raywenderlich.com)
Creating Static Library in iOS App Development

Add the library to a project
There are two methods to add this library to a project. Include the library as a subproject. Which method to choose depends on user preference as well as whether the
source code and project file of the static library are available. The following files are required:
Library file
libownCloudiOS.a
(Library)
Library Classes
OCCommunication.h
(Accessors) Import in the communication class
OCErrorMsg.h
(Error Messages) Import in the communication class
OCFileDto.h
and
OCFileDto.m
(File/Folder object) Import when using
readFolder
and
readFile
methods
OCFrameworkConstants.h
(Customize constants)
Add the library file to the project. Select the library file. Add the path of the library header files. Include the library as a subproject
Follow these steps if this is the desired method. Link the library file to the project target. Finally add the path of the library headers.

Reference the headers and library binary file (
.a
) directly. Reference headers and library binary files
Follow these steps if this is the desired method. From the
Build Phases
tab, scroll to
Link binary files
and select the
+
to add a library. Under the
Target Dependencies
section, select the `+' and choose the library target. Under the
Build
Phases
tab, select the
+' under the `Link Binary with Libraries
section and select the library file.

Under the
Build
Settings
tab, select the target library and add the path in the
Header Search Paths
field. Remaining in the
Build Setting
tab, add the flag
-Obj-C
under the
Other Linker Flags
option. Within the project, navigate to the
Build Phases
tab. Add the flag
-Obj-C
to
Other Linker Flags
under the project target on the
Build Settings
tab. Under the
Build
Settings
tab, add the path under the
Header Search Paths
option.
